Package org.jtrim2.access

Class AccessResult<IDType>

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.access.AccessResult<IDType>
Type Parameters:
IDType - the type of the access ID (see AccessToken.getAccessID())
public final class AccessResult<IDType> extends Object
Defines the result of an AccessToken request from an AccessManager. In case access was granted by the AccessManager the getAccessToken() returns a non-null AccessToken. Regardless if access was granted the result may contain zero or more conflicting AccessTokens which must be released before access can be granted or in case of a scheduled token the returned AccessToken can execute tasks.

Thread safety

Instances of this class are immutable and as such are thread-safe even in the face of unsynchronized concurrent access. Note that although instances are immutable, the shared AccessTokens are not and they must be safely published (with no race condition) to be safely used in multithreaded environment.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are not synchronization transparent unless otherwise noted.
See Also:
  • AccessManager
  • AccessToken

  • Constructor Details

    • AccessResult

      public AccessResult(AccessToken<IDType> accessToken)
      Creates a new AccessResult instance with no conflicting tokens.

      This constructor is intended to be used when access was granted and there are no conflicting tokens.

      Parameters:
      accessToken - the AccessToken representing the requested rights. Although this argument can be null it is not recommended to call with null AccessToken because it means that access was not granted and the conflicting tokens are not known.

    • AccessResult

      public AccessResult(Collection<? extends AccessToken<IDType>> blockingTokens)
      Creates a new AccessResult instance with no AccessToken (getAccessToken() will return null) and the list of the conflicting AccessTokens.

      This constructor is intended to be used when access cannot be granted and the supplied list of AccessTokens defines the conflicting tokens needed to be released before the requested rights can be granted.

      Parameters:
      blockingTokens - the collection of AccessTokens needed to be released before access can be granted. It is not recommended to call this constructor with an empty list of tokens because it means that access was not granted and the conflicting tokens are not known. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing an empty collection. No reference will be retained by this access result to the passed blockingTokens, the collection will be copied. The collection cannot contain null elements however.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the blocking tokens is null

    • AccessResult

      public AccessResult(AccessToken<IDType> accessToken, Collection<? extends AccessToken<IDType>> blockingTokens)
      Creates a new AccessResult instance with the requested AccessToken and the list of the conflicting AccessTokens.

      Although this constructor can be used to define that access to the requested rights was denied, it is intended to be used when access was granted but there are conflicting tokens which must be released before tasks scheduled to the returned AccessToken can execute. This is usually the case when a scheduled token was requested.

      Parameters:
      accessToken - he AccessToken representing the requested rights. This argument can be null in which case getAccessToken() will return null.
      blockingTokens - the collection of AccessTokens needed to be released before access can be granted. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing an empty collection. No reference will be retained by this access result to the passed blockingTokens, the collection will be copied. The collection cannot contain null elements however.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the blocking tokens is null

  • Method Details

    • release

      public void release()
      Releases the returned AccessToken if there was one returned. In case there was no AccessToken returned this method does nothing.

      This method call is effectively equivalent to the following code:

      if (result.isAvailable()) result.getAccessToken().release();

      See Also:
      • AccessToken.release()

    • releaseAndCancel

      public void releaseAndCancel()
      Releases the returned AccessToken and cancels tasks submitted to its executors, if there was an AccessToken returned. In case there was no AccessToken returned this method does nothing.

      This method call is effectively equivalent to the following code:

      if (result.isAvailable()) result.getAccessToken().releaseAndCancel();

      See Also:
      • AccessToken.releaseAndCancel()

    • isAvailable

      public boolean isAvailable()
      Returns true if the access was granted.

      If this method returns true getAccessToken() will return a non-null AccessToken.

      Synchronization transparency

      This method is synchronization transparent.
      Returns:
      true if the access was granted, false otherwise.

    • getBlockingIDs

      public Set<IDType> getBlockingIDs()
      Returns the set of IDs of the conflicting AccessTokens. Notice that the size of the returned set can be smaller (but not larger) than the number of conflicting tokens.

      Synchronization transparency

      This method is synchronization transparent.
      Returns:
      the set of IDs of the conflicting tokens. This method never returns null. In case there are no conflicting tokens this method returns an empty set.

    • getAccessToken

      public AccessToken<IDType> getAccessToken()
      Returns the AccessToken representing the requested rights or null if the request was denied.

      Note that in case of a scheduled token it is possible that there are conflicting tokens.

      Synchronization transparency

      This method is synchronization transparent.
      Returns:
      the AccessToken representing the requested rights or null if the request was denied

    • getBlockingTokens

      public Collection<AccessToken<IDType>> getBlockingTokens()
      Returns the conflicting tokens needed to be released before the requested AccessToken can execute tasks. If there are no conflicting tokens an empty collection is returned.

      Synchronization transparency

      This method is synchronization transparent.
      Returns:
      the conflicting tokens needed to be released before the requested AccessToken can execute tasks. This method never returns null. In case there are no conflicting tokens an empty collection is returned.

    • releaseAndCancelBlockingTokens

      public void releaseAndCancelBlockingTokens()
      Calls the releaseAndCancel() method of the conflicting tokens.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the string representation of this right request result in no particular format.

      This method is intended to be used for debugging only.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the string representation of this object in no particular format. This method never returns null.
